column4: does anybody know how can I specify a DNS server using OpenVPN?
you mean like what DNS gets sent to clients via DHCP ?
vpn server gives me a DNS IP which I dont want to use.
are you controlling the VPN? you can change what DNS it pushes via DHCP in the config
no, I dont control the vpn server
hm how can I push the DNS I want via DHCP
you'd have to have control of the server itself to change that
the only solution is to edit /etc/resolv.conf?
on your machine, yea you could specify dns
are you trying to get around dns filtering ?
no
What's the problem then?
just to use a different DNS server
lower latency, no log, etc
echo "nameserver 127.0.0.1" >> /etc/resolv.conf
yea, not sure if the VPN dns will take over though.  haven't really messed with VPN tunnels via desktop version
but I think you get the idea.  Do you have DiG installed?
bash: /etc/resolv.conf: Permission denied
yes
you use sudo to edit it?
